div.div: Ongoing alignment: The logical models are under active revision and continuous refinement. Updates will be progressively incorporated into this Implementation Guide.

body.p: This page explains how elements from the CancerStage logical model are expressed in the FHIR Resource (TBD) resource used by this Implementation Guide.

tr.td: It represents the classification system to define the stage, such as TNM (Tumor Linphonode Metastasis). nan
It represents the classification system to define the stage, such as TNM (Tumor Linphonode Metastasis). nan

It represents the stage value. Its datatype and cardinality depend on the specific structure of the staging classification being used. For example, in the case of the TNM classification, three string values are expected: one for T (Tumor), one for N (Nodes), and one for M (Metastasis). nan

It represents the stage value. Its datatype and cardinality depend on the specific structure of the staging classification being used. For example, in the case of the TNM classification, three string values are expected: one for T (Tumor), one for N (Nodes), and one for M (Metastasis). nan
It indicates whether the stage instance is of type Clinical or Pathological. Choice: Clinical | Pathological
It indicates whether the stage instance is of type Clinical or Pathological. Choice: Clinical | Pathological
It shall be present when the stage is of type Pathological and shall not be present when the stage is of type Clinical. nan
It shall be present when the stage is of type Pathological and shall not be present when the stage is of type Clinical. nan
It shall be present when the stage is of type Clinical and shall not be present when the stage is of type Pathological. nan
It shall be present when the stage is of type Clinical and shall not be present when the stage is of type Pathological. nan

body.p: Return to overview: Cancer Logical Models -> FHIR Logical Models
